headline: Workers Are Afraid AI Will Take Their Jobs. They’re Missing the Bigger Danger.
summary: It isn’t whether artificial intelligence is going to replace them. It’s who will control the knowledge that companies capture from their employees.

headline: 'The dark side of AI': Wall Street weighs recent stock sell-off over disruption fears
summary: Investor concerns over AI's disruption drove a stock market sell-off in the wealth management, transportation, and logistics industries last week.

headline: Salesforce (CRM) is a Great Company, Says Jim Cramer
summary: We recently published 13 Stocks Jim Cramer Talked About. Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE:CRM) is one of the stocks that Jim Cramer talked about. Customer relationship software products provider Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE:CRM)’s shares are down by 41% over the past year and by 25% year-to-date. Early in February, Oppenheimer reiterated a Buy rating and a $300 share […]

headline: Salesforce AI Push With Cimulate Faces Job Cuts And Ethical Tensions
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) is acquiring Cimulate, an AI startup focused on intent aware search, to strengthen its Agentforce Commerce platform. The deal comes alongside leadership changes, nearly 1,000 job cuts, and internal pushback over Salesforce's work with ICE and its AI rollout. These developments arrive during a period of share price pressure, with Salesforce stock at $189.72. For investors watching NYSE:CRM, this mix of product expansion and internal disruption is arriving after a...

headline: AI risk is dominating conference calls as investors dump stocks
summary: Mentions of AI disruption on management calls almost doubled compared to the previous quarter, a Bloomberg News analysis of transcripts shows.  While the technology hasn’t yet noticeably reduced earnings estimates, investors aren’t waiting around and instead are selling any company perceived to be at risk.  Last week, commercial real estate company CBRE Group Inc. published better-than-expected earnings.
